This app automatically links your saved contacts with matching calendar events and generates personalized SMS reminders. You can select contacts, review calendar entries, customize the message, and send it with a single tap. Additionally, you’ll be notified weekly about how many contacts are ready to receive a message within the next 7 days.\n\n ⚠️ To avoid seeing this guide every time you launch the app, scroll to the very bottom and confirm that you’ve read the instructions.

- Create a contact in your phonebook.
 • Optionally add an academic title (e.g. Dr., Prof.) if you want it to appear in the message salutation.
 • A phone number is required.
 • Once saved, the contact will appear in the app.

- Create a calendar event using the exact first and last name of the contact.
 • The event must have a date and time – all-day events are not supported.
 • Only future events will be considered.
 • Once saved, the app will automatically link the event to the contact.
- Displays all contacts stored in the app’s database.\n • You can delete a contact by tapping the “X” icon.
- Lists all contacts from your phonebook.\n • Select contacts and tap “Add selected” to store them in the app’s database.\n • Events will be automatically linked based on name matching.

- Select contacts and add them to the SMS queue with one click.
 • You can preview and edit the message before sending.
 • When the „Show actives“ button is pressed, only contacts with an actual event are displayed.
 • The remaining time until the next event is displayed for each contact. Only events that are scheduled from today up to seven days in the future are considered. If additional events exist beyond this range, they will be shown automatically once the earlier ones have expired.

- Each contact receives a default message when added.
 • It includes their title (if any), full name, appointment date and time.
 • You may edit the message freely.
 ⚠️ Important: The date and time placeholders must remain in the text, as they are automatically updated.
 ⚠️ The title can, but must not be kept. If you keep the title, then it will be automatically updated.

- Main function: “Send Messages” → displays the current SMS queue.
 • After confirmation, SMS will be sent using your default messaging app.
 • Top-right menu lets you change the app design or open this instruction.
 • The date and time of the last message batch is shown at the bottom.
 ⚠️ If you want to send SMS to more than 30 contacts at once, a confirmation prompt will appear. Simply click „Accept“ each time until no further prompts appear.
- Changes in contacts or calendar entries are synced when returning to the home screen.\n • If the app was fully closed, all data will automatically refresh upon reopening.
This app needs access to your contacts, calendar, and SMS to work properly. Only the notification permission can be denied.

You will now be redirected to the app settings. Please enable all required permissions except „Notifications“ if you don\'t need them, and return to the app afterwards. Otherwise the app will not work as it should.
You can remind %1$d contacts for the next 7 days.
